objtitle.title: Letter to Maria Denman, sister-in-law of John Flaxman, c. 18 March 1827

objdescid.compdate: 1827The day, Wednesday, and date, 18 March 1827, given by Blake in this letter do not coincide. 18 March 1827 was a Sunday. Erdman (page 783) and Keynes (*Letters*, page 167-68) date the letter to 14 March 1827 in brackets. Bentley (*Writings* volume 2, page 1666n5) notes that if the letter was written on a Wednesday, the date could be either 14 March 1827 or 21 March 1827.

objinfo.numberleaves: 1The letter is on one side of a single leaf (object 1), which was folded to form a sealed packet.
objinfo.support: laid paperBentley (*Writings* volume 2, page 1759) notes that similarly spaced chain lines may indicate that Blake used the same stock in this letter as that bearing the "RUSE & TURNERS / 1810" watermark present in his letters of 31 January 1826, 16 July 1826, and 12 April 1827.

provenance.note: Maria Denman; offered as part of the Denman collection sale at Christie, Manson, & Woods, 26-27 February 1883, lot 289, which also included Blake's receipt to Flaxman of 14 December 1799 and a "Short Note to Flaxman", possibly of autumn 1800; acquired by Charles J. Turner; after Turner's death, sold at Henckel's, New York, 8 November 1912, lot 554 to "Manning per Brownback[?]" ($20); later acquired by W. T. Spencer, London; acquired by the Berg Collection of the New York Public Library.

desc.objtitle: Mr Blakes respectful Compliments to Miss Denman, Object 1

objnote.p: The letter is on one side of a single leaf (Object 1), which was folded to form a sealed packet.
Along the top margin, the number “354” is inscribed in ink in an unknown hand. There is a hole in the bottom half of the object near the center, where the seal was torn open.
